course.subject: MARK
course.name: Competitive Positioning
course.description: Analysis of the environment and competitive market space; value analysis, creation, and development of value proposition; strategic options for the creation of a sustainable competitive advantage; attack, counter-attack, and defensive marketing strategies; direct-competitive marketing simulation used as a medium for exposure to the competitive nature of the marketing environment.
course.corequisites: MARK 3220 AND MARK 3420

reviews.author: 易拎
reviews.comment_content:
Term Test 1. 20%
Term Test 2. 20%
On-line Quizzes 5%
In-class Exercises, Homework, and Pop Quizzes 10%
Attendance and Class Participation 8%
MARKSTRAT Performance 15%
MARKSTRAT Initial Plan 5%
Final Report on MARKSTRAT (Written and Oral Presentation) 15%
Research Experiment 2%
reviews.comment_teaching:
Though there are two lectures scheduled each week, but Joseph only conducted once live class per week, and he asked us to watch his teaching video for self-learning and then complete the canvas quiz.
Joseph is very nice and helpful. He is willing to have meetings for consulting your markstrat performance whenever you asked.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is super super super huge. This is the heaviest workload i have ever met. We had group meeting every single week and each lasted for at least 2 hours, just for the markstrat decision.

reviews.comment_content: Quite a lot of content to digest every week. The simulation game is the key point of the course. To me, it was quite a tough one. Not much guidance was given. It was like learning marketing positioning and learning to run a business in the game at the same time.
reviews.comment_teaching: Joseph is a nice professor. Although he won't give a lot of guidance for the game at first, he was very willing to do so after we showed our concerns on not knowing how to handle the game. Other than that, lectures are just normal ones that you usually expect from the university.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading was pretty good. At least better than what I expected. My midterm is mean. Final didn't release marks. However, our group project was pretty bad as we were the bottom last team. But I still got B range at the end so I think it's not bad.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is huge. Every week you have to complete an online quiz plus submit the project decision. It takes a lot of time to discuss the project unless you have some really smart or experienced groupmates.

reviews.author: SmartStan
reviews.title: Fun but REALLY TIRING
reviews.comment_content: The course was mainly about competition. Most of the course is built on top of a simulation game. You have to play the simulation game with your groupmates to compete with other groups weekly. Overall, it is fun but really tiring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Salvacruz is a fine lecturer. He is quite funny and he is a nice guy. I remember once me and my groupmates text him late at night to fix a problem with our simulation game and he replied within 5 mins. Overall, he is a nice professor.
reviews.comment_grading: This course is all about the simulation game. If you mess up your simulation game, you can not have a good grade. On the opposite side, if you are number one in your simulation game, you are guaranteed to get an A. (guaranteed by prof)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is quite intense. Every week me and my groupmate have to have a meeting for a long time to make decisions in the simulation game. We spent about 4 to 5 hours every week in the meeting to figure out what we should do in the next period.

reviews.author: Tommychan
reviews.comment_content: Online lecture videos with in-class discussions. Different marketing strategies are discussed in the content. These strategies are to be useful in the simulation game.
reviews.comment_teaching: The class is partly online where lecture materials are mostly in, the discussions would often be conducted during class time.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very heavy workload with a simulation game. For every week, teams will need to come up with a company decision which is dependent on the company performance and results in the previous week.
Report and presentation are needed at the end of the semester.

reviews.author: xxuxae21
reviews.comment_content:
Little bit of everything - from Consumer Behavior, Decision making process, Marketing Research, Pricing, Promotion & Advertising, and Targeting &Positioning.

There is way too much things to memorize & understand for each quiz even though its non-cumulative.

2 Exams are quite hard. Mean was below 80 for both.
It contains around 30~40 MC + 2 long questions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
You only need to attend one class per week. However, you need to watch online lecture videos every week (1.5 hours long) to complete weekly online quiz.

Basically all contents are covered through online lecture. In class, you will mostly spend time on MARKSTRAT game or in-class exercise.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm - 20%
Final - 20%
MARKSTRAT result - 20%
MARKSTRAT Report & PPT - 20%
Online quiz, in-class exercise, assignment, Participation - 18%
Research credit - 2%

Joseph gives good grades as long as you participate actively during class. :)
reviews.comment_workload:
For each week, you need to complete the following:
1. Watch online Video
2. Complete online quiz
3. Assignment or in-class exercise (mostly group work)
4. MARKSTRAT Decision

To make MARKSTRAT Decision, you also have to spend time analyzing previous data, which takes lot of time. For our group, we met almost twice per week to share our thoughts and finalize our decisions.

Besides weekly work, each group has to write 8 page report regarding MARKSTRAT + 10 minute Presentation.

reviews.author: Kayiu
reviews.comment_content: The content is way too much, it covers a lot of different topics and you have to watch the video by yourself.
reviews.comment_teaching: Half of the material will be online lecture, you need to watch videos and then finish a simple quiz every week.
reviews.comment_workload: You only have 1 class per week(1.5 hour), but you will have tonnes of after-class work to do. We participated a game called MARKSTRAT, you have to submit a decision every week so you may have to meet your group mate every week.
